intro: Caucalis queraltii, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Pyrenees and other mountainous regions in Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Caucalis queraltii is a perennial species, often found in meadows and grasslands at elevations above 1,500 meters. Its delicate appearance and adaptation to harsh climates make it a notable species in alpine botany.
